citations.narrative:
The facility operated and exhibited regulated animals to the public on August 5-6 after their license expired on August 4,
2025 without a USDA license. Although this site has applied for a relicense, the relicensing process has not been
completed and no license has been issued. Exhibition of animals without a valid Class C Exhibitors license puts the
animals and the public at risk and is a violation of the federal Animal Welfare Act.

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
During inspection two dogs were examined by APHIS officials and were noted to have dental tarter.
-Bailey, male cocker spaniel, (chip# 600569793) had dental tarter. On veterinary exam dated 1OCT2024 the attending
veterinarian (AV) noted "moderate dental tarter" and the plan was to perform a dental. No dental was noted in the medical
record.
-Charlie, male miniature poodle, (chip # 604884516) had dental tarter. On veterinary exam dated 29April2025 the AV
noted "moderate tarter" and the plan was to perform tarter removal. No dental was noted in the medical record.
Failure to provide appropriate methods to properly diagnose and treat dental problems in a timely manner may result in
difficulty eating, pain, and suffering.
Correct by providing appropriate methods to properly diagnose and treat conditions in a timely manner.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by October 6, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
You should not conduct regulated activity without a valid license
n

narrative:
2.1(a)(1) 
   
Requirements and application. 
The facility operated and exhibited regulated animals to the public on August 5-6 after their license expired on August 4, 
2025 without a USDA license. Although this site has applied for a relicense, the relicensing process has not been 
completed and no license has been issued. Exhibition of animals without a valid Class C Exhibitors license puts the 
animals and the public at risk and is a violation of the federal Animal Welfare Act. 
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
During inspection two dogs were examined by APHIS officials and were noted to have dental tarter.  
-Bailey, male cocker spaniel, (chip# 600569793) had dental tarter. On veterinary exam dated 1OCT2024 the attending 
veterinarian (AV) noted "moderate dental tarter" and the plan was to perform a dental. No dental was noted in the medical 
record.  
-Charlie, male miniature poodle, (chip # 604884516) had dental tarter. On veterinary exam dated 29April2025 the AV 
noted "moderate tarter" and the plan was to perform tarter removal. No dental was noted in the medical record. 
Failure to provide appropriate methods to properly diagnose and treat dental problems in a timely manner may result in 
difficulty eating, pain, and suffering. 
Correct by providing appropriate methods to properly diagnose and treat conditions in a timely manner. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by October 6, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
You should not conduct regulated activity without a valid license
